body.p:
Louisville 14th Feby 1862
To his Excellency Gov. Magoffin
Dear Sir

I wish the appointment of Notary Public for Jefferson County. I held that office under the appointment of Gov. Powell some years ago but my commission has expired. I am a practicing lawyer in this city & only wish the appointment for the convenience of taking the affidavits of my clients in the range of my own practice. For my character I refer you to Messrs Speed, Wolf, Beeman & almost any one you may meet with in Frankfort from this city. If you will present my name to the Senate I will feel greatly obliged. Would it not be well to have a general law passed authorizing all regular attorneis to take the affidavits of their clients? I was accustomed to that arrangement in Carolina where I practiced many years. The gentlemen above referred to differ from me in politics but will doubtless do me Justice personally.

Very Respectfully yours --
J. L. Clemmons

Notaries Public
& Manager to Western Lunatic Asylum
Nominated Feby 20 1862
